member.name: T:osu.Framework.Allocation.CachedAttribute
member.summary: An attribute that may be attached to a class, interface, field, or property definitions of a to indicate that the value should be cached as a dependency. Cached values may be resolved through or .
member.remarks:
The behaviour of this attribute differs in meaning depending on the type of member it is placed on.
In the case of fields and properties, the dependency will be cached for the children of the drawable that contains the field or property.
Unless specified differently by , the dependency will be cached using the field/property value's concrete (most-derived) type. See the examples section of the property documentation for further information.
Instances of classes annotated with will cache themselves for their own children. Unless specified differently by , the dependency will be cached using the type at the point where the was declared.
Note that while the itself is not inherited, derived class instances will still cache themselves using the base class. See the examples section of the property documentation for further information.
If a class implements an interface annotated with , then instances of that class will cache themselves for their own children using the interface type. As with classes, the is not inherited between interfaces either, but an instance of a class will cache itself to children using all cacheable interface types that it implements.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Allocation.CachedAttribute.Type
member.summary:
The type to cache the value as. If null, the type depends on the type of member that the attribute is placed on:
In the case of fields and properties, the attribute will use the concrete/most-derived type of the field/property's value.
In the case of classes and interfaces, the attribute will use the class/interface type on which the was directly placed.

example.para:
In the case of classes, given the following structure:
[Cached] public class A { }
public class B : A { }
the following things will happen:
Instances of A will cache themselves to children using type A.
Instances of B will cache themselves to children using type A.
Instances of B will not cache themselves to children using type B. To achieve that effect, the has to be repeated on class B.
placed in interface inheritance hierarchies follows analogous rules to the ones described above for classes.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Allocation.CachedAttribute.Name
member.summary: The name to identify this member with.
member.remarks: If the member is cached with a custom that provides a parent, the name is automatically inferred from the field/property.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Allocation.DependencyActivator
member.summary: Helper class that provides methods to merge dependencies of objects and inject dependencies into objects. The process of merging/injecting dependencies into objects happens in a "bottom-up" manner from least derived to most derived. E.g. Drawable -> CompositeDrawable -> Toolbar, etc...
member.remarks:
Injection of dependencies is ordered into two processes:
1) Inject into properties marked with . 2) Invoke methods marked with .

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Audio.AudioManager.UsingGlobalMixer
member.summary: Whether a global mixer is being used for audio routing. For now, this is only the case on Windows when using shared mode WASAPI initialisation.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Audio.AudioManager.GlobalMixerHandle
member.summary: If a global mixer is being used, this will be the BASS handle for it. If non-null, all game mixers should be added to this mixer.
member.remarks:
When this is non-null, all mixers created via will themselves be added to the global mixer, which will handle playback itself.
In this mode of operation, nested mixers will be created with the flag, meaning they no longer handle playback directly.
An eventual goal would be to use a global mixer across all platforms as it can result in more control and better playback performance.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Audio.Mixing.Bass.BassAudioMixer.ChannelGetData(osu.Framework.Audio.Mixing.Bass.IBassAudioChannel,System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the immediate sample data (or an FFT representation of it) of a channel.
member.remarks: See: .
member.param: The to retrieve the data of.
float[] to write the data to.
Number of bytes wanted, and/or .
member.returns:
If an error occurs, -1 is returned, use to get the error code.
When requesting FFT data, the number of bytes read from the channel (to perform the FFT) is returned.
When requesting sample data, the number of bytes written to buffer will be returned (not necessarily the same as the number of bytes read when using the or DataFlags.Fixed flag).
When using the flag, the number of bytes in the channel's buffer is returned.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo
member.summary: ColourInfo contains information about the colours of all 4 vertices of a quad. These colours are always stored in linear space.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.SingleColour(osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour)
member.summary: Creates a ColourInfo with a single linear colour assigned to all vertices.
member.param: The single linear colour to be assigned to all vertices.
member.returns: The created ColourInfo.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.GradientHorizontal(osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour,osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour)
member.summary: Creates a ColourInfo with a horizontal gradient.
member.param: The left colour of the gradient.
The right colour of the gradient.
member.returns: The created ColourInfo.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.GradientVertical(osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour,osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour)
member.summary: Creates a ColourInfo with a vertical gradient.
member.param: The top colour of the gradient.
The bottom colour of the gradient.
member.returns: The created ColourInfo.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.TryExtractSingleColour(osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour@)
member.summary: Attempts to extract the single colour represented by this .
member.param: The extracted colour. If false is returned, this represents the top-left colour.
member.returns: Whether the extracted colour is the single colour represented by this .

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.Interpolate(osu.Framework.Graphics.Primitives.Quad)
member.summary: Interpolates this across a quad.
member.remarks: This method is especially useful when working with multi-colour s. When such a colour is interpolated across a quad that is a subset of the unit quad (0, 0, 1, 1), the resulting colour can be thought of as the the original colour but "cropped" to the bounds of the subquad.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.MultiplyAlpha(System.Single)
member.summary: Created a new ColourInfo with the alpha value of the colours of all vertices multiplied by a given alpha parameter.
member.param: The alpha parameter to multiply the alpha values of all vertices with.
member.returns: The new ColourInfo.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.AverageColour
member.summary: The average colour of all corners.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.MaxAlpha
member.summary: The maximum alpha value of all four corners.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.ColourInfo.MinAlpha
member.summary: The minimum alpha value of all four corners.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour
member.summary: A wrapper struct around Color4 that takes care of converting between sRGB and linear colour spaces. Internally this struct stores the colour in sRGB space, which is exposed by the member. This struct converts to linear space by using the member.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour.SRGB
member.summary: A representation of this colour in the sRGB space.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour.Linear
member.summary: A representation of this colour in the linear space.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour.Alpha
member.summary: The alpha component of this colour.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Colour.SRGBColour.MultiplyAlpha(System.Single)
member.summary: Multiplies the alpha value of this colour by the given alpha factor.
member.param: The alpha factor to multiply with.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Component
member.summary: An updateable component that can be inserted into the draw hierarchy. This is currently used as a marker for cases where nothing more than load, update, lifetime support and hierarchy presence are required. Eventually this will be fleshed out (and the inheritance will be reversed to Drawable : Component).

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.AudioContainer`1
member.summary: A container which exposes audio adjustments via .
member.remarks: This is a bare-minimal implementation of a container, so it may be required to be nested inside a for some use cases.
member.typeparam: The type of .

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.AudioContainer
member.summary: A container which exposes audio adjustments via .
member.remarks: This is a bare-minimal implementation of a container, so it may be required to be nested inside a for some use cases.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer
member.summary: A container that renders its children to an internal framebuffer, and then blits the framebuffer to the screen, instead of directly rendering the children to the screen. This allows otherwise impossible effects to be applied to the appearance of the container at the cost of performance. Such effects include uniform fading of children, blur, and other post-processing effects. If all children are of a specific non- type, use the generic version .

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1
member.summary: A container that renders its children to an internal framebuffer, and then blits the framebuffer to the screen, instead of directly rendering the children to the screen. This allows otherwise impossible effects to be applied to the appearance of the container at the cost of performance. Such effects include uniform fading of children, blur, and other post-processing effects.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.DrawOriginal
member.summary: If true the original buffered children will be drawn a second time on top of any effect (e.g. blur).

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.BlurSigma
member.summary: Controls the amount of blurring in two orthogonal directions (X and Y if is zero). Blur is parametrized by a gaussian image filter. This property controls the standard deviation (sigma) of the gaussian kernel.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.BlurRotation
member.summary: Rotates the blur kernel clockwise. In degrees. Has no effect if has the same magnitude in both directions.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.EffectColour
member.summary: The multiplicative colour of drawn buffered object after applying all effects (e.g. blur). Default is . Does not affect the original which is drawn when is true.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.EffectBlending
member.summary: The to use after applying all effects. Default is . inherits the blending mode of the original, i.e. is used. Does not affect the original which is drawn when is true.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.EffectPlacement
member.summary: Whether the buffered effect should be drawn behind or in front of the original. Behind by default. Does not have any effect if is false.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.BackgroundColour
member.summary: The background colour of the framebuffer. Transparent black by default.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.UsingCachedFrameBuffer
member.summary: Whether the rendered framebuffer is being cached until is called or the size of the container (i.e. framebuffer) changes. If false, then the framebuffer is re-rendered before it is blitted to the screen; equivalent to calling every frame.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.RedrawOnScale
member.summary: Whether to redraw this when the draw scale changes.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.ForceRedraw
member.summary: Forces a redraw of the framebuffer before it is blitted the next time. Only relevant if is true.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.updateVersion
member.summary: In order to signal the draw thread to re-draw the buffered container we version it. Our own version (update) keeps track of which version we are on, whereas the drawVersion keeps track of the version the draw thread is on. When forcing a redraw we increment updateVersion, pass it into each new drawnode and the draw thread will realize its drawVersion is lagging behind, thus redrawing.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.BufferedContainer`1.#ctor(osu.Framework.Graphics.Rendering.RenderBufferFormat[],System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructs an empty buffered container.
member.param: The render buffer formats attached to the frame buffer of this .
Whether the frame buffer position should be snapped to the nearest pixel when blitting. This amounts to setting the texture filtering mode to "nearest".

Whether the rendered frame buffer should be cached until is called or the size of the container (i.e. frame buffer) changes. When disabled, drawing will be clipped to the game window bounds. Enabling can allow drawing larger than (or outside) the game window bounds.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CircularContainer

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CompositeComponent
member.summary: An updateable component that can be inserted into the draw hierarchy and has self-managed child components. This is currently used as a marker for cases where nothing more than load, update, lifetime support and hierarchy presence are required. Eventually this will be fleshed out (and the inheritance will be reversed to Drawable : Component).

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CompositeDrawable
member.summary: A drawable consisting of a composite of child drawables which are manages by the composite object itself. Transformations applied to a are also applied to its children. Additionally, s support various effects, such as masking, edge effect, padding, and automatic sizing depending on their children.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CompositeDrawable.MaskingSmoothness
member.summary: Determines over how many pixels the alpha component smoothly fades out. Only has an effect when is true.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CompositeDrawable.CornerRadius
member.summary: Determines how large of a radius is masked away around the corners. Only has an effect when is true.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CompositeDrawable.CornerExponent
member.summary: Determines how gentle the curve of the corner straightens. A value of 2 (default) results in circular arcs, a value of 2.5 results in something closer to apple's "continuous corner". Values between 2 and 10 result in varying degrees of "continuousness", where larger values are smoother. Values between 1 and 2 result in a "flatter" appearance than round corners. Values between 0 and 1 result in a concave, round corner as opposed to a convex round corner, where a value of 0.5 is a circular concave arc. Only has an effect when is true and is non-zero.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CompositeDrawable.BorderThickness
member.summary: Determines how thick of a border to draw around the inside of the masked region. Only has an effect when is true. The border only is drawn on top of children using a sprite shader.
member.remarks: Drawing borders is optimized heavily into our sprite shaders. As a consequence borders are only drawn correctly on top of quad-shaped children using our sprite shaders.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.CompositeDrawable.BorderColour

member.summary: Determines over how many pixels the alpha component smoothly fades out when an inner or is present. Only has an effect when is true.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.Container`1.CornerRadius
member.summary: Determines how large of a radius is masked away around the corners. Only has an effect when is true.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.Container`1.CornerExponent
member.summary: Determines how gentle the curve of the corner straightens. A value of 2 results in circular arcs, a value of 2.5 (default) results in something closer to apple's "continuous corner". Values between 2 and 10 result in varying degrees of "continuousness", where larger values are smoother. Values between 1 and 2 result in a "flatter" appearance than round corners. Values between 0 and 1 result in a concave, round corner as opposed to a convex round corner, where a value of 0.5 is a circular concave arc. Only has an effect when is true and is non-zero.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.Container`1.BorderThickness
member.summary: Determines how thick of a border to draw around the inside of the masked region. Only has an effect when is true. The border only is drawn on top of children using a sprite shader.
member.remarks: Drawing borders is optimized heavily into our sprite shaders. As a consequence borders are only drawn correctly on top of quad-shaped children using our sprite shaders.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.Container`1.BorderColour

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.Container`1.EdgeEffect

member.summary: Changes the position of the drawable in the layout. A higher position value means the drawable will be processed later (that is, the drawables with the lowest position appear first, and the drawable with the highest position appear last). For example, the drawable with the lowest position value will be the left-most drawable in a horizontal and the drawable with the highest position value will be the right-most drawable in a horizontal .

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.SearchContainer`1
member.summary: A container which automatically filters children based on a search term. Re-filtering will only be performed when the changes, or the layout of the container is invalidated.

list.item: Children which are searchable should be marked with the interface. They do not need to be direct children to work (filtering will traverse the full drawable subtree).
Marking a container (ie. a "group" or "section" that contains nested s) as will automatically keep it non-filtered as long as at least one nested item is not filtered away.

Any s which are contained in a which has set to will be excluded from filtering. This can be used to exclude certain items from consideration (ie. items which are hidden from display), allowing group/sections to be correctly filtered away.

member.name: E:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.SearchContainer`1.FilterCompleted
member.summary: Fired whenever a filter operation completes.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.SearchContainer`1.AllowNonContiguousMatching
member.summary: Whether the matching algorithm should consider cases where other characters exist between consecutive characters in the search term. If true, searching for "BSI" will match "BeatmapSetInfo".

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.SearchContainer`1.SearchTerm
member.summary: A string that should match the children

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.SearchContainer`1.Filter
member.summary: Immediately filter children based on the current .
member.remarks:
Filtering is done automatically after a change to , on new drawables being added, and on certain changes to searchable children (like changing).
However, if or any of its parents are hidden this will not be run. If an implementation relies on filtering to become present / visible, this method can be used to force a filter.
Note that this will only run if the current filter is not in an already valid state.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Containers.SearchContainer`1.checkTerm(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Check whether a search term exists in a forward direction, allowing for potentially non-matching characters to exist between matches.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Drawable
member.summary:
Drawables are the basic building blocks of a scene graph in this framework. Anything that is visible or that the user interacts with has to be a Drawable.
For example: - Boxes - Sprites - Collections of Drawables
Drawables are always rectangular in shape in their local coordinate system, which makes them quad-shaped in arbitrary (linearly transformed) coordinate systems.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Drawable.RequiredParentSizeToFit
member.summary: Returns the size of the smallest axis aligned box in parent space which encompasses this drawable while preserving this drawable's . If a component of is smaller than zero or larger than one, then it is impossible to preserve while fitting into the parent, and thus returns zero in that dimension; i.e. we no longer fit into the parent. This behavior is prominent with non-centre and non-custom values.

member.summary: Currently loading (possibly and usually on a background thread via ).

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.FillMode
member.summary: Controls the behavior of when it is set to .

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.FillMode.Stretch
member.summary: Completely fill the parent with a relative size of 1 at the cost of stretching the aspect ratio (default).

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.FillMode.Fill
member.summary: Always maintains aspect ratio while filling the portion of the parent's size denoted by the relative size. A relative size of 1 results in completely filling the parent by scaling the smaller axis of the drawable to fill the parent.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.FillMode.Fit
member.summary: Always maintains aspect ratio while fitting into the portion of the parent's size denoted by the relative size. A relative size of 1 results in fitting exactly into the parent by scaling the larger axis of the drawable to fit into the parent.

member.summary: Forces removal of this drawable from its parent, followed by immediate synchronous disposal.
member.remarks:
This is intended as a temporary solution for the fact that there is no way to easily dispose a component in a way that is guaranteed to be synchronously run on the update thread.
Eventually components will have a better method for unloading.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Primitives.IPolygon.GetAxisVertices
member.summary: The vertices that define the axes spanned by this polygon in screen-space counter-clockwise orientation.
member.remarks:
Counter-clockwise orientation in screen-space coordinates is equivalent to a clockwise orientation in standard coordinates.
E.g. For the set of vertices { (0, 0), (1, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1) }, a counter-clockwise orientation is { (0, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1), (1, 0) }.
member.returns: The vertices that define the axes spanned by this polygon.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Primitives.IPolygon.GetVertices
member.summary: Retrieves the vertices of this polygon in screen-space counter-clockwise orientation.
member.remarks:
Counter-clockwise orientation in screen-space coordinates is equivalent to a clockwise orientation in standard coordinates.
E.g. For the set of vertices { (0, 0), (1, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1) }, a counter-clockwise orientation is { (0, 0), (0, 1), (1, 1), (1, 0) }.
member.returns: The vertices of this polygon.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Primitives.Quad.Contains(osuTK.Vector2)
member.summary: Checks whether is inside of this quad.

remarks.para: This method assumes a convex quad. The convexity of the quad is not checked. Vertices of the quad as returned by must be arranged either in clockwise or counter-clockwise order.

The method works by checking whether the point lies on the same side of all four sides of the quad. Note that the quad vertices are *not* using the standard Cartesian coordinates, but rather a Y-inverted version of them (as in higher Y is *down*), which is why the sign of the perpendicular dot product is opposite to what would be normally expected on the Cartesian plane.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Primitives.Quad.Area
member.summary: Computes the area of this .
member.remarks: If the quad is self-intersecting the area is interpreted as the sum of all positive and negative areas and not the "visible area" enclosed by the .

member.summary: Handles contiguous allocation of all uniform buffer memory.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Rendering.Deferred.Allocation.UniformBufferManager.buffer_chunk_size
member.summary: For renderers which support binding buffer ranges, the buffer is split and bound in 64KiB chunks. This is a sane value which is supported by all renderers: - D3D11: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/d3d11_1/nf-d3d11_1-id3d11devicecontext1-vssetconstantbuffers1 Supports 4096 constants, where a "constant" is a float4. - Metal: https://developer.apple.com/metal/Metal-Feature-Set-Tables.pdf Supports 65536 constants, where a "constant" is a type. We'll assume float. - OpenGL: Does not explicitly define a limit. The minimum block size defined by the standard is 16KiB, but this is based on the shader's definition rather than bind size.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Rendering.IRenderer.CreateShaderStorageBufferObject``1(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a buffer that can be used to store an array of data for use in a .
member.param: The number of elements this buffer should contain if Shader Storage Buffer Objects are not supported by the platform. A safe value is 16384/{data_size}. The value must match the definition of the UBO implementation in the shader.
The number of elements this buffer should contain if Shader Storage Buffer Objects are supported by the platform. May be any value up to {vram_size}/{data_size}.

list.item: Internally, this buffer may be implemented as either a "Uniform Buffer Object" (UBO) or a "Shader Storage Buffer Object" (SSBO) depending on the capabilities of the platform.
UBOs are more broadly supported but cannot hold as much data as SSBOs.
Shaders must provide implementations for both types of buffers to properly support this storage.

member.typeparam: The type of data to be stored in the buffer.
member.returns: An .

IMPORTANT: When masking an edge-smoothed sprite some of the smooth transition may be masked away. member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Textures.TextureStore.max_atlas_size
member.remarks: While it would be beneficial to have this atlas size be higher (the ideal size seems to be somewhere in the ballpark of 4096), built-in GL mipmapping performs poorly on atlases bigger than this maximum. If the built-in GL mipmapping is replaced in the future (see custom generation logic in `{GL,Veldrid}Texture`), then this limit can be increased to 4096 again.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Textures.TextureStore.ScaleAdjust
member.summary: Decides at what resolution multiple this is providing sprites at. ie. if we are providing high resolution (at 2x the resolution of standard 1366x768) sprites this should be 2.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.UserInterface.TextBox.textInputScheduler
member.summary: Scheduler used for scheduling text input events coming from .
member.remarks: Used for scheduling text events so that the is updated on the update thread. This scheduler is updated in two places / at two points in time: - Early in the update frame, in , so that the key event is blocked. We assume a key event that comes right after a text event is associated with that text event and therefore should be blocked. In other words: to ensure consistent UX, if a user presses a key to input text then no other action (eg. from a keyboard shortcut) should be taken by the game, so we block it. - Later in the same update frame, in . In case there was no associated key event. This is mostly required for mobile platforms.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.UserInterface.TextBox.textInputBlocking
member.summary: Whether s should be blocked because of recent text input from a .
member.remarks:
Blocking starts when a text events occurs and ends when all keys are released (or on the next frame if no keys are pressed).
We currently eagerly block keydown events, blocking all key events until all keys are released. This means that some key events will be (erroneously) blocked, even if they weren't associated with a text event. This simplified logic is used because trying to associate each key event with a text event is error prone. Some reasons as to why: - Text and key repeat rate are inherently different, since text repeat is handled by the OS, while handles key repeat. - The ordering of keydown and text events can vary between platforms. - The ordering of the events can vary even more because these events are propagated to the textbox differently: - Key events are propagated by at the beginning of each update frame. - Text events are propagated immediately when they're received, and are handled either by the call or , whichever comes first. (Check usages of . for specifics.) - This is especially problematic if the key and text events arrive in between the and updates.
So we catch the first key that produced text and block until we get back to a sane state (all keys released).

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.UserInterface.TextBox.ImeCompositionActive
member.summary: Whether there is a ongoing IME composition.
member.remarks: The IME should take full input priority, as a lot of the common text editing keys/shortcuts are used internally in the IME for compositing. Full data about the composition events is processed by "passively" so we shouldn't take any action on key events we receive.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Veldrid.Batches.VeldridVertexBatch`1.vertex_buffer_count
member.summary:
Most documentation recommends that three buffers are used to avoid contention.
We already have a triple buffer (see ) governing draw nodes. In theory we could set this to two, but there's also a global usage of a vertex batch in (see ).
So this is for now an unfortunate memory overhead. Further work could be done to provide these in a way they were not created per draw-node, reducing buffer overhead from 9 to 3.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Veldrid.Shaders.VeldridShaderPart.WithPassthroughInput(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyList{osu.Framework.Graphics.Veldrid.Shaders.VeldridShaderAttribute})
member.summary: Creates a based off this shader with a list of attributes passed through as input & output. Attributes from the list that are already defined in this shader will be ignored.

remarks.para: In D3D11, unused fragment inputs cull their corresponding vertex output, which affects the vertex input/output structure leading to seemingly undefined behaviour. To prevent this from happening, make sure all unused vertex output are used and sent in the fragment output so that D3D11 doesn't omit them.
This creates a new rather than altering this existing instance since this is cached at a level and should remain immutable.

member.param: The list of attributes to include in the shader as input & output.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder
member.summary: Represents a video decoder that can be used convert video streams and files into textures.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.Duration
member.summary: The duration of the video that is being decoded. Can only be queried after the decoder has started decoding has loaded. This value may be an estimate by FFmpeg, depending on the video loaded.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.IsRunning
member.summary: True if the decoder currently does not decode any more frames, false otherwise.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.IsFaulted
member.summary: True if the decoder has faulted after starting to decode. You can try to restart a failed decoder by invoking again.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.LastDecodedFrameTime
member.summary: The timestamp of the last frame that was decoded by this video decoder, or 0 if no frames have been decoded.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.FrameRate
member.summary: The frame rate of the video stream this decoder is decoding.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.CanSeek
member.summary: True if the decoder can seek, false otherwise. Determined by the stream this decoder was created with.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.State
member.summary: The current state of the decoding process.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.TargetHardwareVideoDecoders
member.summary: Determines which hardware acceleration device(s) should be used.

member.summary: Creates a new video decoder that decodes the given video file.
member.param: The renderer to display the video.
The path to the file that should be decoded.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.#ctor(osu.Framework.Graphics.Rendering.IRenderer,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates a new video decoder that decodes the given video stream.
member.param: The renderer to display the video.
The stream that should be decoded.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.Seek(System.Double)
member.summary: Seek the decoder to the given timestamp. This will fail if is false.
member.param: The timestamp to seek to.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.ReturnFrames(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.DecodedFrame})
member.summary: Returns the given frames back to the decoder, allowing the decoder to reuse the textures contained in the frames to draw new frames.
member.param: The frames that should be returned to the decoder.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.StartDecoding
member.summary: Starts the decoding process. The decoding will happen asynchronously in a separate thread. The decoded frames can be retrieved by using .

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.StopDecodingAsync
member.summary: Stops the decoding process.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.GetDecodedFrames
member.summary: Gets all frames that have been decoded by the decoder up until the point in time when this method was called. Retrieving decoded frames using this method consumes them, ie calling this method again will never retrieve the same frame twice.
member.returns: The frames that have been decoded up until the point in time this method was called.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.VideoDecoder.GetAvailableDecoders(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID,osu.Framework.Graphics.Video.HardwareVideoDecoder)
member.remarks: Returned HW devices are not guaranteed to be available on the current machine, they only represent what the loaded FFmpeg libraries support.

member.summary: The decoder has reached the end of the video data.

member.summary: The decoder has been completely stopped and cannot be resumed.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.HostOptions
member.summary: Various configuration properties for a .

member.name: P:osu.Framework.HostOptions.IPCPort
member.summary: The IPC port to bind. This port should be between 1024 and 49151, should be shared by all instances of a given osu!framework app, but be distinct from IPC ports specified by other osu!framework apps. See for more details on usage.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.HostOptions.PortableInstallation
member.summary: Whether this is a portable installation. Will cause all game files to be placed alongside the executable, rather than in the standard data directory.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.HostOptions.BypassCompositor
member.summary: Whether to bypass the compositor. Defaults to true.
member.remarks:
On Linux, the compositor re-buffers the application to apply various window effects, increasing latency in the process. Thus it is a good idea for games to bypass it, though normal applications would generally benefit from letting the window effects untouched.
If the SDL_VIDEO_X11_NET_WM_BYPASS_COMPOSITOR environment variable is set, this property will have no effect.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.HostOptions.FriendlyGameName
member.summary: The friendly name of the game to be hosted. This is used to display the name to the user, for example in the window title bar or in OS windows and prompts.
member.remarks: If empty, GameHost will choose a default name based on the gameName.

member.summary: A drawable that handles scroll actions.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.IScrollBindingHandler`1.OnScroll(osu.Framework.Input.Events.KeyBindingScrollEvent{`0})
member.summary: Triggered when a scroll action is pressed.
member.remarks: When the action is not handled by any , is called. In either cases, will be called once.
member.param: The event containing information about the scroll.
member.returns: True if this Drawable handled the event. If false, then the event is propagated up the scene graph to the next eligible Drawable.

member.summary: The input queue to be used for processing key bindings. Based on the non-positional . Can be overridden to change priorities.

member.summary: Whether this should attempt to handle input before any of its children.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.KeyBindingContainer`1.pressedInputKeys
member.summary: All input keys which are currently pressed and have reached this .

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.KeyBindingContainer`1.releasePressedActions(osu.Framework.Input.States.InputState)
member.summary: Releases all pressed actions. Note that the relevant key bindings remain in a pressed state by the user and are not released by this method.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.KeyBindingContainer
member.summary: Maps input actions to custom action data.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.KeyBindingContainer.HandleRepeats
member.summary: Whether key repeat events should be sent. Defaults to true.
member.remarks: Key repeats will invoke actions at the same rates as events. Disabling this is recommended if you either don't require key repeats (quite often applicable to gameplay input), or want a custom repeat rate.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.SimultaneousBindingMode.None
member.summary: One action can be in a pressed state at once. If a new matching binding is encountered, any existing binding is first released.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.SimultaneousBindingMode.Unique
member.summary: Unique actions are allowed to be pressed at the same time. There may therefore be more than one action in an actuated state at once. If one action has multiple bindings, only the first will trigger an . The last binding to be released will trigger an .

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Input.Bindings.SimultaneousBindingMode.All
member.summary: Unique actions are allowed to be pressed at the same time, as well as multiple times from different bindings. There may therefore be more than one action in an pressed state at once, as well as multiple consecutive events for a single action (followed by an eventual balancing number of events).

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Input.InputManager.mouse_source_debounce_time
member.summary: The length in time after which a lower priority input handler is allowed to take over mouse control from a high priority handler that is no longer reporting. It's safe to assume that all input devices are reporting at higher than the debounce time specified here (20hz). If the delay seen between device swaps is ever considered to be too slow, this can likely be further increased up to 100hz.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Input.PassThroughInputManager
member.summary: An with an ability to use parent 's input.
member.remarks: There are two modes of operation for this class: When is false, this input manager gets inputs only from own input handlers. When is true, this input manager ignore any local input handlers and gets inputs from the parent (its ancestor in the scene graph) in the following way: For mouse input, this only considers input that is passed as events such as . For keyboard and other inputs, this input manager try to reflect parent 's closely as possible. Thus, when this is attached to the scene graph initially and when becomes true, multiple events may fire to synchronise the local with the parent's.

member.param: If this is false, assume parent input manager is unchanged from before.

only permits a limited set of parameter types for attributes,
and as such instances cannot be passed in directly. Therefore usages must pass both the target type in which the description is declared, as well as the name of the member which contains/returns the (using for this is strongly encouraged).

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Logging.Logger.flush_sync_lock
member.summary: Separate locking object for flushing so that we don't lock too long on the staticSyncLock object, since we have to hold this lock for the entire duration of the flush (waiting for I/O etc) before we can resume scheduling logs but other operations like GetLogger(), ApplyFilters() etc. can still be executed while a flush is happening.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.GameHost.maximum_sane_fps
member.summary:
Games using osu!framework can generally run at *very* high frame rates when not much is going on.
This can be counter-productive due to the induced allocation and GPU overhead. - Allocation overhead can lead to excess garbage collection - GPU overhead can lead to unexpected pipeline blocking (and stutters as a result). Also, in general graphics card manufacturers do not test their hardware at insane frame rates and therefore drivers are not optimised to handle this kind of throughput. - We only harvest input at 1000hz, so running any higher has zero benefits.
We limit things to the same rate we poll input at, to keep both gamers and their systems happy and (more) stutter-free.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Platform.MacOS.Native.Class.SwizzleMethod(System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,System.Delegate)
member.summary: Performs method swizzling for a given selector, using a given delegate implementation.
member.remarks: This essentially adds a new Objective-C method, then swaps the implementation with an existing one. Returns a selector to the newly registered method, which has the original implementation of before swizzling. https://nshipster.com/method-swizzling/
member.param: The Objective-C class which should have a method swizzled.
The selector to swizzle.
The type encoding of the selector.
The delegate to use as the new implementation.
member.returns: A selector for the newly registered method, containing the old implementation.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Platform.SDL2.SDL2Window.RunMainLoop
member.summary: Runs the main window loop.
member.remarks:
By default this will block and indefinitely call as long as the window . Once the main loop finished running, cleanup logic will run.
This may be overridden for special use cases, like mobile platforms which delegate execution of frames to the OS and don't require any kind of exit logic to exist.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Platform.SDL2.SDL2Window.RelativeMouseMode
member.summary: Set the state of SDL2's RelativeMouseMode (https://wiki.libsdl.org/SDL_SetRelativeMouseMode). On all platforms, this will lock the mouse to the window (although escaping by setting is still possible via a local implementation). On windows, this will use raw input if available.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Platform.SDL2.SDL2Window.MouseAutoCapture
member.summary: Controls whether the mouse is automatically captured when buttons are pressed and the cursor is outside the window. Only works with disabled.
member.remarks: If the cursor leaves the window while it's captured, is not sent until the button(s) are released. And if the cursor leaves and enters the window while captured, is not sent either. We disable relative mode when the cursor exits window bounds (not on the event), but we only enable it again on . The above culminate in staying off when the cursor leaves and enters the window bounds when any buttons are pressed. This is an invalid state, as the cursor is inside the window, and is off.

By default this will block and indefinitely call as long as the window . Once the main loop finished running, cleanup logic will run.
This may be overridden for special use cases, like mobile platforms which delegate execution of frames to the OS and don't require any kind of exit logic to exist.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Platform.SDL3.SDL3Window.RelativeMouseMode
member.summary: Set the state of SDL3's RelativeMouseMode (https://wiki.libsdl.org/SDL_SetRelativeMouseMode). On all platforms, this will lock the mouse to the window (although escaping by setting is still possible via a local implementation). On windows, this will use raw input if available.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Platform.SDL3.SDL3Window.MouseAutoCapture
member.summary: Controls whether the mouse is automatically captured when buttons are pressed and the cursor is outside the window. Only works with disabled.
member.remarks: If the cursor leaves the window while it's captured, is not sent until the button(s) are released. And if the cursor leaves and enters the window while captured, is not sent either. We disable relative mode when the cursor exits window bounds (not on the event), but we only enable it again on . The above culminate in staying off when the cursor leaves and enters the window bounds when any buttons are pressed. This is an invalid state, as the cursor is inside the window, and is off.

member.summary: An application directs the IME to close a candidate list. The dwIndex parameter specifies an index of the list to close, and dwValue is not used.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.Imm.NotificationCode.NI_SELECTCANDIDATESTR
member.summary: An application has selected one of the candidates. The dwIndex parameter specifies an index of a candidate list to be selected. The dwValue parameter specifies an index of a candidate string in the selected candidate list.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.Imm.NotificationCode.NI_CHANGECANDIDATELIST
member.summary: An application changed the current selected candidate. The dwIndex parameter specifies an index of a candidate list to be selected and dwValue is not used.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.Imm.NotificationCode.NI_COMPOSITIONSTR
member.summary: An application directs the IME to carry out an action on the composition string. The dwIndex parameter can be from .

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.Imm.NotificationCode.NI_SETCANDIDATE_PAGESTART
member.summary: The application changes the page starting index of a candidate list. The dwIndex parameter specifies the candidate list to be changed and must have a value in the range 0 to 3. The dwValue parameter specifies the new page start index.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.Imm.NotificationCode.NI_SETCANDIDATE_PAGESIZE
member.summary: The application changes the page size of a candidate list. The dwIndex parameter specifies the candidate list to be changed and must have a value in the range 0 to 3. The dwValue parameter specifies the new page size.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.Imm.NotificationCode.NI_IMEMENUSELECTED
member.summary: An application directs the IME to allow the application to handle the specified menu. The dwIndex parameter specifies the ID of the menu and dwValue is an application-defined value for that menu item.

member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.Remove
member.summary: If set, this removes the top level collection from the inclusion list. This tells the operating system to stop reading from a device which matches the top level collection.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.Exclude
member.summary: If set, this specifies the top level collections to exclude when reading a complete usage page. This flag only affects a TLC whose usage page is already specified with PageOnly.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.PageOnly
member.summary: If set, this specifies all devices whose top level collection is from the specified usUsagePage. Note that Usage must be zero. To exclude a particular top level collection, use Exclude.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoLegacy
member.summary: If set, this prevents any devices specified by UsagePage or Usage from generating legacy messages. This is only for the mouse and keyboard.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.InputSink
member.summary: If set, this enables the caller to receive the input even when the caller is not in the foreground. Note that WindowHandle must be specified.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.CaptureMouse
member.summary: If set, the mouse button click does not activate the other window.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoHotKeys
member.summary: If set, the application-defined keyboard device hotkeys are not handled. However, the system hotkeys; for example, ALT+TAB and CTRL+ALT+DEL, are still handled. By default, all keyboard hotkeys are handled. NoHotKeys can be specified even if NoLegacy is not specified and WindowHandle is NULL.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.Native.RawInputDeviceFlags.AppKeys
member.summary: If set, application keys are handled. NoLegacy must be specified. Keyboard only.

member.summary: Amount of extra width added to window size when in borderless mode on Windows. Some drivers require this to avoid the window switching to exclusive fullscreen automatically.
member.remarks: Used on and .

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Platform.Windows.SDL2WindowsWindow.SetIconFromGroup(osu.Framework.Platform.IconGroup)
member.summary: On Windows, SDL will use the same image for both large and small icons (scaled as necessary). This can look bad if scaling down a large image, so we use the Windows API directly so as to get a cleaner icon set than SDL can provide. If called before the window has been created, or we do not find two separate icon sizes, we fall back to the base method.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Threading.GameThreadSynchronizationContext
member.summary: A synchronisation context which posts all continuations to an isolated scheduler instance.
member.remarks: This implementation roughly follows the expectations set out for winforms/WPF as per https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/archive/msdn-magazine/2011/february/msdn-magazine-parallel-computing-it-s-all-about-the-synchronizationcontext. - Calls to are guaranteed to run asynchronously. - Calls to will run inline when they can. - Order of execution is guaranteed (in our case, it is guaranteed over and calls alike). - To enforce the above, calling will flush any pending work until the newly queued item has been completed.

member.summary: Run any pending work queued against this synchronization context.

member.summary: Disassociate any references to the provided at construction time. This ensures external components cannot hold a reference to potentially expensive game instances.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Threading.ScheduledDelegate.PerformRepeatCatchUpExecutions
member.summary: In the case of a repeating execution, setting this to true will allow the delegate to run more than once at already elapsed points in time in order to catch up to current. This will ensure a consistent number of runs over real-time, even if the running the delegate is suspended. Setting to false will skip catch-up executions, ensuring a future time is used after each execution.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Timing.DecoupleableInterpolatingFramedClock
member.summary:
Adds the ability to keep the clock running even when the underlying source has stopped or cannot handle the current time range. This is handled by performing seeks on the underlying source and checking whether they were successful or not. On failure to seek, we take over with an internal clock until control can be returned to the actual source.
This clock type removes the requirement of having a source set.
If a is set, it is presumed that we have exclusive control over operations on it. This is used to our advantage to allow correct state tracking in the event of cross-thread communication delays (with an audio thread, for instance).

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Timing.DecoupleableInterpolatingFramedClock.IsCoupled
member.summary: Specify whether we are coupled 1:1 to SourceClock. If not, we can independently continue operation.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Timing.DecoupleableInterpolatingFramedClock.useInterpolatedSourceTime
member.summary: In some cases we should always use the interpolated source.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Timing.DecoupleableInterpolatingFramedClock.adjustableSource
member.summary: We need to be able to pass on adjustments to the source if it supports them.

member.name: T:osu.Framework.Timing.DecouplingFramedClock
member.summary:
A decoupling clock allows taking an existing clock which has seek limitations and provides a controllable encapsulated view of that clock with the ability to seek and track time outside of the normally seekable bounds.
Put simply, it will take a Track which can only track time from 0..trackLength and allow both negative seeks and seeks beyond trackLength. It will also allow time to continue counting beyond the end of the track even when not explicitly seeked.
member.remarks: There are a few things to note about this implementation: - Changing the source clock via will always take on the new source's running state and current time, regardless of decoupled state. - It is always assumed that after a on the source, it will be able to track time. - It is assumed that a source is generally able to start tracking from zero. Special handling ensures that when arriving at zero from negative time, the source will attempt to be started once so it can take over. Note that no such special handling is assured for when the source has a maximum allowable time, since it is not known what that time is.

member.name: P:osu.Framework.Timing.DecouplingFramedClock.AllowDecoupling
member.summary: Whether to allow operation in decoupled mode. Defaults to true.
member.remarks: When set to false, this clock will operate in a transparent pass-through mode.

member.name: F:osu.Framework.Timing.DecouplingFramedClock.shouldBeRunning
member.summary: We maintain an internal running state so that when we notice the source clock has stopped, we can continue to run in a decoupled mode (and know if we should be running or not).

member.summary: Creates an arbitrary spline approximation from a piecewise-linear path. Works for any spline type where the interpolation is a linear combination of the control points.
member.param: The piecewise-linear path to approximate.

A 2D matrix that contains the spline basis functions at multiple positions. The length of the first dimension is the number of test points, and the length of the second dimension is the number of control points.
The number of optimization steps.
The rate of optimization. Larger values converge faster but can be unstable.
The B1 parameter for the Adam optimizer. Between 0 and 1.
The B2 parameter for the Adam optimizer. Between 0 and 1.
The initial control points to use before optimization. The length of this list should be equal to the number of test points.
Mask determining which control point positions are fixed and cannot be changed by the optimiser.
member.returns: A List of vectors representing the spline control points.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Utils.PathApproximator.bezierIsFlatEnough(osuTK.Vector2[])
member.summary: Make sure the 2nd order derivative (approximated using finite elements) is within tolerable bounds. NOTE: The 2nd order derivative of a 2d curve represents its curvature, so intuitively this function checks (as the name suggests) whether our approximation is _locally_ "flat". More curvy parts need to have a denser approximation to be more "flat".
member.param: The control points to check for flatness.
member.returns: Whether the control points are flat enough.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Utils.PathApproximator.bezierSubdivide(osuTK.Vector2[],osuTK.Vector2[],osuTK.Vector2[],osuTK.Vector2[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Subdivides n control points representing a bezier curve into 2 sets of n control points, each describing a bezier curve equivalent to a half of the original curve. Effectively this splits the original curve into 2 curves which result in the original curve when pieced back together.
member.param: The control points to split.
Output: The control points corresponding to the left half of the curve.
Output: The control points corresponding to the right half of the curve.
The first buffer containing the current subdivision state.
The number of control points in the original list.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Utils.PathApproximator.bezierApproximate(osuTK.Vector2[],System.Collections.Generic.List{osuTK.Vector2},osuTK.Vector2[],osuTK.Vector2[],System.Int32)
member.summary: This uses De Casteljau's algorithm to obtain an optimal piecewise-linear approximation of the bezier curve with the same amount of points as there are control points.
member.param: The control points describing the bezier curve to be approximated.
The points representing the resulting piecewise-linear approximation.
The number of control points in the original list.
The first buffer containing the current subdivision state.
The second buffer containing the current subdivision state.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Utils.Validation.TryParseUri(System.String,System.Uri@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse as an absolute or relative in a platform-agnostic manner.
member.remarks: This method is a workaround for inconsistencies across .NET and mono runtimes; on mono runtimes paths starting with / are considered absolute as per POSIX, and on .NET such paths are considered to be relative. This method uses the .NET behaviour. For more info, see Mono documentation.
member.param: The string representation of the URI to parse.
The resultant parsed URI, if parsing succeeded.
member.returns: if parsing succeeded; otherwise.

member.name: M:osu.Framework.Utils.Validation.IsSupportedBindableNumberType``1
member.summary: Whether the specified type is a number type supported by .
member.remarks: Directly comparing typeof(T) to type literal is recognized pattern of JIT and very fast. Just a pointer comparison for reference types, or constant for value types. The check will become NOP in usages after optimization.
member.typeparam: The type to check for.
member.returns: if the type is supported; otherwise.
